name: NH Carlton Amsterdam

reviews.text: Staff friendly and helpful. Communal areas and bedroom clean. Reasonable size room (think it was a superior room). Furnishings very drab which made the room seem very dark. Good choice of english speaking channels on TV. Tea making facilities in room but plastic cups and powdered milk. Very good location - easy walking distance from most of the attractions. Overall a good experience, but would have expected a bit more for the money.
reviews.title: Very clean room

likes.liked: — Conveniently placed for all the tourist attractions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked for 4 nights in mid-September as we had previously stayed here 3 years ago. Since then the hotel has been given a face-lift. The rates were higher than normal (we booked through a NL hotel booking site online) due to a big conference taking place during the week but even though they were all busy, the staff were helpful and friendly. For an extra 25 euros a night you can upgrade on arrival to a superior room (50 euros for a deluxe) which is well worth doing if you can! We asked for a room at the front and found it was well sound proofed even though you had the trams and nightlife til late!
reviews.title: Great location, clean with helpful staff

likes.liked: — Clean with new fittings. Larger than average room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice and safe hotel. Flower market is in front of the hotel as well as a vast array of restaurants. Main gay district is just behind the hotel. Everything within walking distance. The farthest we walked (slow walk) was to the Anne Frank house, about 30-40 minutes but every corner has something new to discover. Rooms small but comfotable and extremely clean. Staff is very helpful. Breakfast in the main dining room pricey (euro 15) for what they had but numerous cafes for breakfast around the corner at Rebrandt square.
reviews.title: Very pleased

reviews.text: Excellent location! Right on the flower market canal. Rooms were clean and reasonably modern. The staff were helpful.
reviews.title: Great location!
Not a 4 star
reviews.text: Not a 4 star more like a 3. Our smoking room was basic with peeling and cracked wall paper/plaster. Ask for a room away from the main road otherwise you can hear the trams and cars ect until the early morning. Good location being next to the floating flower market and about 20 minutes walk to Dam Square.

reviews.title: Jolly Carlton Right Choice for Us
reviews.text: We chose this hotel based on its location, which was the right decision for our 5-day visit. The view from our 6th floor room with a balcony and large French doors was nothing short of wonderful. We looked directly at the Munt Plein, and when it was lighted at night and the bells were chiming, the effect was exactly what we were looking for on this visit. When the doors were closed, and room-darkening draperies drawn, this deluxe room was quiet.
The room was clean and the bathroom was updated and also very clean.
reviews.title: Old facilities and Staff Not helpful
Very central and comfortable hotel
reviews.text: The staff at the front desk (as well as the doormen) was helpful and courteous to us during our entire five days. We asked a lot of questions, and also needed their help making dinner reservations for us. All this was done immediately, and in a most pleasant manner. I found NO FAULT with the staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an Italian hotel chain, and love being with Italians.
reviews.title: Great Deluxe View Rooms!

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a full-service hotel in a great location.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: We stayed in the jolly carlton hotel for 3 nights. it was within walking distance to dam square and the main shopping street it was in a perfect location. The weather was very hot when we said (28 degrees) but our rooms had air conditioning so that was a major bonus. The rooms were fresh and clean and the staff were very helpful. We did not have breakfast in the hotel as it was over priced but there are so many cafes and restaurants along the canals. I would recommend the Jolly Carlton Hotel 100%. Loved it
reviews.title: Fantastic Location

reviews.text: I booked here at short notice through a website for 109 euro which is good for Amsterdam at the moment. I had a room with a view over the flower market and Muntplein. Reception staff were freidly and efficient. The room was smallish butcontained everything needed inc. tea/coffee and safe. Both room and bathroom were clean and well maintained.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Good location

reviews.text: The bad points were the queen bed was 2 singles which drew apart during the night(very romantic!) and the shower going from perfect to scalding to freezing, that they really should fix. If not for this i would give 4*
reviews.title: Good location, and some rooms are a (nice) surprise

reviews.text: The rates for this hotel can vary a lot. I got a room for 109 € which was very low, so even if below I give some remarks, the value for money was excellent.
reviews.title: Great Location
Great location,average room
reviews.text: LOCATION

Booked on internet and stayed here for one night. I chose this hotel because the pickings were slim due to a last minute travel decision, and I seem to recall I had stayed here a few years ago and found it nice. However, I was THOROUGHLY disappointed!! The hotel looks nice, but was really dated inside. Staff was rude - I asked for change to park my car, and they were really reluctant and then finally gave me a bunch of small coins although they had plenty of others. I mean, the least they could do for their guests was to welcome us upon our arrival!! The heat wasn't working properly and I was freezing all night. I asked for a non-smoking room but got a room that smelled like an old bar PLUS it smelled heavily of insecticide. Never again!
reviews.title: Never ever again!

likes.disliked: — Staff, rooms, odor, old, etc need I go on

reviews.text: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Jolly Carlton. The Hotel itself isnt bad, I give it 3 stars out of 5 . The room we got was 2 beds, the beds are not that comfortable, definetly dated. The carpet, room furniture and TV are very dated. But most importantly everything was clean, sheets and bathroom included. The bathroom is actually very nice. We stayed in room 316 , which seemed very lucky since the view was excellent, opening up to a nice little street , and it had a terrace. Internet is expensive in the hotel at .35 Euro per minute. There were about 4 English networks on the TV. Location of the Hotel was superb. Bars,Coffee shops, flower market, shopping , and nice resturants very close. Almost everything is in walking distance - Including Red Light , museums , Brewery and Central Station. The Zoo was a bit of a walk but only because I think we got lost. I would reccomend this hotel for a short, budgeted stay. But if you could afford more and need to be pampered look elsewhere. I would equate it to a Holiday Inn or Best Western in the USA. There is room service from the Italian restaurant beneath the hotel, the restaurant has excellent Brick Oven pizza, there;s also a great Chinese resturant on the corner. There's a Dutch Supermarket called Albert Heijn that is a 2 minute walk and is a great place to pick up snacks for the room. All in all the hotel was satisfactory, the sanitized bathroom is the biggest selling point.
reviews.title: Not Bad, Good Value, Dated but Clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this via Lastminute.com
reviews.title: Would giv it another go, but a bit disappointed with the room

likes.disliked: — room clean but exceptionallysmelly, needed air freshner

reviews.text: Arrived in Amsterdam at about 12.00 noon and the hotel took our luggage and dealt with the paperwork. We went and enjoyed the city for a few hours and returned to book into our room. the reception area, lifts etc were pretty impressive and we had read good reviews about the place.
reviews.title: GREAT hotel, great location, highly recommended!!!

reviews.text: we were disappointed when we opened the door to our room to find a nicotine coloured melamine vision from the 70's.
reviews.title: Very central
This would have been a 5* rating but we were charged for damage we didn't do!!!
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at this hotel on a "3 for the price of 2" deal with Superbreaks. Very good location, and the staff were extremely helpful. Room clean and tidy with balcony albeit it was a bit too chilly to use the balcony at this time of year. Shower temperature a bit tempramental (as per other reviews). However on returning home to the UK I discovered that my credit card had been charged £70 (100 euros) for smoke damage to a non-smoking room. We are both non-smokers and did not cause any damage! No joy at present disputing this with the hotel who have a Report/photos claiming to be our room. So, our reasonably priced weekend break has just got considerably more expensive as its our word against theirs! CHECK YOUR ROOM THOROUGHLY!!!! I think this is probably a scam they do to claw back money from cheap breaks. Otherwise I would have highly recommended the hotel to all friends and family...

reviews.title: 4 star disguised as a 2 star
reviews.text: This was an over-priced hotel. The service was terrible, cold-fish who made you feel guilty for asking a question. They charged horendous fees for everything.... if they are a luxury hotel should wireless internet not be standard? Or how about local calls? The fact the flimsy curtains wouldnt close, or the fact the shower would go from SCALDING hot to frigid.... and when we called they said that "all the showers do that".... but without turning the dial? I was 5mos pregnant and the shower just about launched me to the floor because it got so scalding half way through my shower. The staff didn't care. The breakfast was WAY over priced (I suggest going for a 2min walk across the street, there is a greatlittle cafe). Other then the location, this was a 2 star, advertising and priced to try and pretend to be a 4 star.

I just returned from a 5 night stay in Amsterdam at the Jolly Carlton Hotel. I really enjoyed my stay there. This was my 3rd trip to AMS and the most enjoyed. The location of the hotel is perfect. It is in the center of it all, everything the dam has to offer is within a mile or so radius. The room was decent sized, 2 twin beds pushed together, full bath with a tub large enough to hold me a 6'2" man, minibar, and my room even had a little balcony where you could go out and have a smoke. Decent restaraunts in area, I recomend the Indoesian & Chinese places on the corner, as well as the breakfast at the hotel, nice spread for 12 euro. I would stay here again and would recomend this place. 2 thumbs up!
reviews.title: Nice Place, Met all of my needs....
Crap service
reviews.text: My partner & I stayed at the Jolly Carlton January 2006. Great room, loved the location (right by the Bloemenmarket) but the service was appalling. On one day our room was not cleaned until we complained about it about on our return at 4.30; my partner was scalded by a surge of boiling water whilst in the shower which was only suppressed by a continued application of cold sponges.When we complained about it, they stuck a notice in the shower area warning of the hot water! And then to cap it all, on our final day, with a check out time of noon, we packed most things away and went out leaving a few items that we needed, out. In marked contrast to previous days, our room was cleaned on time and the items that had been left out thrown out. It was only thanks to reception and housekeeping that most of the items were recovered from the garbage. 4 star? NOT!
Clean, Central Location, friendly staff, had a great view of the city from the top floor.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed at the jolly carlton for 2 nights at the end of October 2007. Great central location near the floating flower markets. Easy access to shops , restaurants, trams etc.
reviews.title: great central location

reviews.text: The hotel has an impressive lobby and helpful staff . We booked a standard double room as we were only there for 2 nights and didn't see the point of paying the extra 50 euro per night for a luxury room. The rooms were small but big enough for our short stay as we were only in the room a couple of hours as there is so much to do and see in Amsterdam.
reviews.title: Had A Great Time

reviews.text: The only below average thing that I saw whilst staying at the jolly carlton were the "grotty" looking stairwell that didin't seem to belong to the rest of the hotel at all (as I have a fear of elevators I used the stairs daily, and I'm sure that I was the only guest at the hotel that used them). We opted out of paying for the breakfast as we felt it was very expensive for 20 euro each per day (lovely little cafe around the corner that does a full english for 8 euros each)
reviews.title: Jolly Carlton is Jolly Rotten

likes.liked: — The waitress in the restaurant lent me her map.
likes.disliked: — The fact that they were inflexible about finding me another room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amsterdam itself is a lovely city with loads to see and do during the day and night. We pre booked an excursion for the Windmills and Edam tour which was a half day (4 hour) excursion It was a pleasant enough trip but we felt that we were being rushed from one place to the other and not having enough time to browse for souveniers in the the shops. Having arrived in Edam (beware shops are closed on Mondays) we only had 45 mins to have lunch and have a look around. We will definately be visiting Amsterdam again and will again stay at the Jolly Carlton because of the great central location.
reviews.title: Great central hotel

likes.disliked: — the room views were overlooking buildings

reviews.text: just come back from amsterdam been staying at the jolly carlton with friends for 3 nights, i was very impressed with the hotel and would recommend it to anyone, the hotel room was nice and clean and light, and the location was great, would recommend and will be going there to stay again!
reviews.title: Be careful wit front rooms

reviews.text: Just returned from a great stay at the Jolly Carlton hotel in Amsterdam. The hotel is in an excellent location- right beside the Flower market. It's a central location- not too noisy or seedy at night. My stay at the hotel was absolutely perfect-- very friendly staff who upgraded us to a deluxe room free of charge and without even mentioning it. The room was spacious and nicely furnished. large bathroom (shower good-- no problems with the hot water at all). We didn't have breakfast there as we wanted to get to places (e.g. the Caravaggio-Rembrandt ex. at the Van Gogh musuem) early, before the crowds.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Jolly Carlton, Amsterdam

reviews.text: I would completely recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again. Amsterdam is a brilliant city and the Dutch people are the friendliest and most polite people in Europe!!
reviews.title: good location

reviews.text: we have just returned from a 5 day stay at the jolly carlton,the location is great,the hot water supply is very tempremental and on occasions can get VERY hot,our room was not cleaned until on average 3.30pm daily although the maid usually woke us up at about 8.15 am humming and singing as she went up and down the corridor,at night it could be noisy from the street below ,on the first night we could"nt open the mini-bar and on reporting this we were told that the bars in the town were open until 5.00am ,not the answer we wanted really,we had breakfast once in our room for which the service charge is 8 euros, we found that there were better and cheaper options in the many eating places nearby. ,how-ever it was not all negative and we did enjoy our stay ,the reception staff were help-full and the rest of the staff very pleasant,the hotel is within easy walking distance of dam square,central station,and right next door to the floating flower market.
reviews.title: A decent 4-star hotel
Great Location
reviews.text: I stayed at the Jolly Hotel Carlton from February 19th to 22nd, 2006. I requested and received a nonsmoking room which was really nonsmoking--never quite guaranteed when you are in Europe. I should add that I only paid about $110 a night via hotels which was quite a bargain.

The service was formal but adequate. Knowing Italian is a plus here because half the staff is from Italy, particularly those who work at the restaurant. That said, the reception desk people speak perfect English, and so does the hotel operator. Breakfast costs something like 12 Euros extra, but because I already knew this from the website, I never tried it. There are some wonderful pastry and coffee shops just down the street, like Kweekboom on Reguliersbreestraat, so you really have no reason to pay big bucks for a hotel breakfast unless you really wish to.
reviews.title: Jolly Carlton Review

reviews.text: We have just returned from a very pleasant 3 night stay at the Jolly Carlton in Amsterdam during the period between Christmas and New Year. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The staff were very polite, friendly and couldn't do enough for you. The room was more than adequate for our needs. It was clean and tidy and as there was a thermostat in the room, the temperature was just right. We were on the 7th floor so noise was not a problem. There was a big choice at breakfast and again the staff were very friendly and quick to take your order for hot drinks and the made to order omelettes, scrambled eggs etc.
reviews.title: Brilliant Hotel - would recommend to anyone

reviews.text: The hotel was in a perfect location to explore all the sights in Amsterdam. It was just over 5 minutes walk to Dam Square and a couple of minutes away from Rembrantplein where there were lots of bars, clubs and restaurants.
reviews.title: Absolutly loved the Hotel Jolly
A hotel where "EFFICIENCY" is the keyword
reviews.text: I will definitely stay that this hotel on our next trip to Amsterdam.

We stayed at the jolly from 26th dec to 30th dec. We were a bit apprehensive as we had read a few negative reviews,we needn't have worried, as soon as we entered the hotel we new this was going to be an enjoyable stay. The hotel is fabulous, absolutely spotless and the most efficient we have ever stayed in
reviews.title: Fabulous central location

reviews.text: When we booked in we were upgraded free of charge )and without asking ) to a superior room, a porter took our bags and escorted us to our room which was huge and gorgeous, We had 2 4ft beds side by side, there was a bath robe and slippers for the lady. Plenty of tea and coffee, and a sweet with a message by our beds. The bathroom was lovely really big with 2 was basins, shower and a bath. Ther was a hairdryer, but this was in the bathroom so you had to stand I think they could put a stool in there, as usual with foreign hotels there was no plug by a mirror in the lounge so couldnt use own hairdryer, I gave up and stood. After we unpacked we went down stairs and the manager asked us if we liked our room, we thought this was a real personel touch . All the staff were really friendly as were all the dutch. It was freezing cold in Amsterdam so the warm hotel was very welcoming, heating is on in the rooms 24hrs, you can turn it to whatever temperature you want. When we booked out we left our luggage in the hotel, I have never seen this done so proffesionaly your bags were tagged and we were given a duplicate.Anything really valuable was put behind the desk and locked up. We would not stay in a different hotel if we go back to amsterdam.We took the schipol shuttle from the airport they are every half hour from the airport, we had a return cost 35 euros (£24total) for 2 of us right to the jolly. The hotel cost us £284 total for the room ,that £35 each per nt, booked with cheeptravel or cheephotels on net (spelt as seen)
reviews.title: Incompetent and not very helpful

description: Modernized Commercial Hotel situated in the heart of the city, overlooking the Flower Market, near shopping.
